Class BouncingBalls

  • java.lang.Object
    • BouncingBalls
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class BouncingBalls
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Version:
    1.0 This BouncingBalls class is where the Application Window is created. This will create a new Ball object with each click of the mouse and add it to the window. This works by using an ArrayList of all the balls created. Each ball that is created will begin with a new thread running the Move class that will animate the ball movements in the window from the PaintComponent method by redrawing each ball location as they are updated int he Move class.
    Author:
    Alex Wong wong4a@gmail.com

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  BouncingBalls.Draw
      This the drawing class that will draw the balls that are in the ArrayList.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Ball b
      The Ball Object that will be used to create balls and have its inherited and modifiable properties.
      (package private) BouncingBalls.Draw d1
      A new drawing object that is created for drawing in the balls into the window.
      private javax.swing.JFrame frame
      The JFrame that is the main window for the BouncingBalls Application
      private java.util.ArrayList<Move> tasks
      The ArrayList that will hold all the tasks that will be created for separate threads that will create and update movement of each ball that is created.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BouncingBalls()
      This is the constructor class that will create the window for where the balls will be displayed and animated.
